bibl.title: Telegram from Bonnie Truby to Philip Showalter Hench, March 3, 1954

div1.p: Truby informs Hench that Albert E. Truby has passed away.

div1.head: Telegram from Bonnie Truby to Philip Showalter Hench, March 3, 1954
div1.p:
This is a full-rate
Telegram or Cable-
gram unless its de-
ferred character is in-
dicated by a suitable
symbol above or pre-
ceding the address.

SYMBOLS
---------------
DL=Day Letter
---------------
NL=Night Letter
---------------
LT=Int'l Letter Telegram
---------------
VLT=Int'l Victory Ltr.
The filing time shown in the date line on telegrams and day letters is STANDARD TIME at point of origin. Time of receipt is STANDARD TIME at point of destination

GENERAL TRUBY PASSED AWAY QUIETLY FROM HEART ATTACK EARLY
THIS MORNING MARCH 3RD AT LETTERMAN ARMY HOSPITAL. MILITARY
SERVICES AND BURIAL AT PRESIDIO NATIONAL CEMETERY SAN
FRANCISCO FRIDAY MARCH 5TH 2PM HE WAS ONLY IN HOSPITAL
FOUR DAYS AND SUFFERED LITTLE PAIN=
THE COMPANY WILL APPRECIATE SUGGESTIONS FROM ITS PATRONS CONCERNING ITS SERVICE
